item.title: Parking on pathway, 3rd November
item.description:
A car has been parked on the footpath, blocking the way for pedestrians. This is forcing people with prams, wheelchairs, and mobility aids to go onto the road, which is unsafe. Please could someone attend or take action? The car is parked day and night,at different hours. Address is 8 Berkley Place EN8 8AA. I tried to approach the owner but he became very irascible. NUMBER PLATE WF18 UFK white mercedes

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Lane, Waltham Cross
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign to identify homes 8-18, 3rd November
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Malpas Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Vehicle involved in a traffic accident blocking crossing, obstructing junction, 3rd November
item.description:
This vehicle was involved in an accident on Saturday, and has become marooned on top of the crossing bollards at the entrance to Copers Cope Road. Nobody seems to be in a hurry to move it, but it is posing two significant issues: 1. It is fully blocking a bollard crossing point, and this is a significant threat to pedestrian safety, especially now schools are back in session 2. The position of the car creates a severely obstructed view of Southend Road for vehicles exiting Copers Cope Road onto Southend Road. It is essentially creating an accident waiting to happen. I'm baffled by the lack of urgency in moving this vehicle to a safer location, even if its onwards removal to the owner's home needs to be done by a recovery company or insurance firm. This is one for a Police or Council recovery truck to lift and remove to a safer point asap please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Copers Cope Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White van parked blocking zebra crossing, 3rd November
item.description:
A common occurrence here. A bollard or two is urgently needed. People don’t heed the zig-zag markings and just assume they can park here as there’s pavement parking further up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lanes, Palmers Green, London

item.title: Tree making mess is private garden, 3rd November
item.description:
I reported a long time ago and several times that two big trees on council land opposite our block is creating light issues. Moreover, during autumn time the leaves land in our garden due to wind. I asked the council to trim these trees but nothing happened. Now my question is that who will collect / pay for collecting the leaves in a communal garden of our block of flats? Residents should not pay for council created issues. Pls advise what can be done. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayow Road, Perry Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet
